intro: Cudrania javanensis var. bancroftii, commonly known as the Bankroft's cudrania, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
